channel.title: ocaml on Martin Trojer
channel.description: Recent content in ocaml on Martin Trojer

item.title: This year in F#
item.description: For the third year running, here’s my annual (and extremely subjective) review of the state of the F# language, its community and other loosely connected things. How would I sum up the noises coming from F# the last year? Pretty darn awesome. Alot of what’s been happening was on my wish-list outlined in [last year’s post](https://martintrojer.github.io/post/2012-10-24-the-future-of-net-lies-in-mono-the-future-of-f-lies-in-monodevelop/. What are the highlights?
